AF.content: death drive destroys archives, anarchic, destroys its own trace, operates in silence
AF.linkedContent: death drive destroys archives, anarchic, destroys its own trace, operates in silence

AF.content: leaves no monument/document of its own > as inheritance, leaves on its erotic simulacrum (erogenous color draws mask on skin): origin of beautiful > memories of death
AF.linkedContent: leaves no monument/document of its own > as inheritance, leaves on its erotic simulacrum (erogenous color draws mask on skin): origin of beautiful > memories of death

AF.content: death drive incites annihilation of memory and commands the effacement [i.e. effacing nature] of supplement
AF.linkedContent: death drive incites annihilation of memory and commands the effacement [i.e. effacing nature] of supplement

AF.content: archive requires repetition, repetition permits memory but is indissociable from death drive—so archive introduces forgetfulness, archiviolithic, always works against itself (auto-immunity)
AF.linkedContent: archive requires repetition, repetition permits memory but is indissociable from death drive—so archive introduces forgetfulness, archiviolithic, always works against itself (auto-immunity)

AF.content: death drive destroys archive, unless it can be made up as idol, represented, painted, erotic simulacrum
AF.linkedContent: death drive destroys archive, unless it can be made up as idol, represented, painted, erotic simulacrum

AF.content: death drive is archive fever, not a principle, aneconomy, threatens every principality, every archontic primacy, every archival desire: its silent vocation > burn the archive, incite amnesia, ruin archive as accumulation and capitalization of memory
AF.linkedContent: death drive is archive fever, not a principle, aneconomy, threatens every principality, every archontic primacy, every archival desire: its silent vocation > burn the archive, incite amnesia, ruin archive as accumulation and capitalization of memory

AF.content: no archive drive w/out radical finitude, possibility of forgetfulness; death drive’s threat is infinite [radical evil], sweeps away logic of finitude, opens political-ethical questions
AF.linkedContent: no archive drive w/out radical finitude, possibility of forgetfulness; death drive’s threat is infinite [radical evil], sweeps away logic of finitude, opens political-ethical questions

AF.content: if repetition is in the heart of future to-come, so is total annihilation of death drive
AF.linkedContent: if repetition is in the heart of future to-come, so is total annihilation of death drive

AF.content: desire for archive: homesickness for the archaic place of absolute commencement > en mal d’archive [in need of archive, in archive fever, in death drive]
AF.linkedContent: desire for archive: homesickness for the archaic place of absolute commencement > en mal d’archive [in need of archive, in archive fever, in death drive]

AF.content: archive made possible by destruction drive as originary finitude and expropriation, also no archive fever or desire w/out in-finite movement of radical destruction
AF.linkedContent: archive made possible by destruction drive as originary finitude and expropriation, also no archive fever or desire w/out in-finite movement of radical destruction

POOF.content: [re: friend–enemy] is ultimate pessimism the absolute ambivalence of those hospitable to death drive [Freud, Empedocles]? > fool & sage never stop laughing w/ each other
POOF.linkedContent: [re: friend–enemy] is ultimate pessimism the absolute ambivalence of those hospitable to death drive [Freud, Empedocles]? > fool & sage never stop laughing w/ each other

POOF.content: we can’t exclude fact that when someone speaks they strive not to be understood, diabolical figure of death drive > so can the accord of hyperbolic lovence be possible, hoping to be understood beyond all dialectics, haunting (failure) must leave an imprint on the body it seems to threaten, merging indissociably, it’s impossible not to aspire to this haunting [a necessity]: instant of decision remains heterogenous, undecidable, crucial experience of perhaps
POOF.linkedContent: we can’t exclude fact that when someone speaks they strive not to be understood, diabolical figure of death drive > so can the accord of hyperbolic lovence be possible, hoping to be understood beyond all dialectics, haunting (failure) must leave an imprint on the body it seems to threaten, merging indissociably, it’s impossible not to aspire to this haunting [a necessity]: instant of decision remains heterogenous, undecidable, crucial experience of perhaps

A.content: Heidegger’s distinction btwn sterben and verenden not irreconcilable w/ Freud’s thought re: fact that our mortality via death drive isn’t testified by science, our beliefs or the unconscious
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s distinction btwn sterben and verenden not irreconcilable w/ Freud’s thought re: fact that our mortality via death drive isn’t testified by science, our beliefs or the unconscious

FSW.content: for Freud, deferral, detour (Aufschub), death at origin of life [already death drive] defending itself against death via economy of death, the attempt to douse the pain of an original breach
FSW.linkedContent: for Freud, deferral, detour (Aufschub), death at origin of life [already death drive] defending itself against death via economy of death, the attempt to douse the pain of an original breach

FSW.content: “no doubt life protects itself by repetition, trace, differance”—but there’s no life present at first, life is trace so we can say life is death
FSW.linkedContent: “no doubt life protects itself by repetition, trace, differance”—but there’s no life present at first, life is trace so we can say life is death

FSW.content: “repetition”—death as power, lack of power—institutes translatability, makes possible “language,” transforms absolute idiom into a limit toujours déjà transgressed (pure idiom is not language, becomes so only through repetition), repetition divides point of departure of first time; however, to only look at effect of repetition, at translation, obvious distinction btwn force & meaning, effaces intensity of death drive
FSW.linkedContent: “repetition”—death as power, lack of power—institutes translatability, makes possible “language,” transforms absolute idiom into a limit toujours déjà transgressed (pure idiom is not language, becomes so only through repetition), repetition divides point of departure of first time; however, to only look at effect of repetition, at translation, obvious distinction btwn force & meaning, effaces intensity of death drive

POS.content: dissemination via death drive links new concept of repetition to value of mimesis
POS.linkedContent: dissemination via death drive links new concept of repetition to value of mimesis

P.content: Kant: examples are wheelchairs (Gängelwagen) [roulettes] of judgment, those who don’t have enough Mutterwitz, the sick, need these wheelchairs, prostheses that replace nothing
P.linkedContent: Kant: examples are wheelchairs (Gängelwagen) [roulettes] of judgment, those who don’t have enough Mutterwitz, the sick, need these wheelchairs, prostheses that replace nothing

P.content: Hegel: there is play in examples, they play, Beispielen
P.linkedContent: Hegel: there is play in examples, they play, Beispielen

P.content: Derrida, via Hegel: examples divert energy of ergon, introduce chance & abyss into necessity of Mutterwitz > this can make one lose one’s head, a Russian roulette (death drive and mourning of labor in experience of beautiful), to put into play pleasure w/out enjoyment
P.linkedContent: Derrida, via Hegel: examples divert energy of ergon, introduce chance & abyss into necessity of Mutterwitz > this can make one lose one’s head, a Russian roulette (death drive and mourning of labor in experience of beautiful), to put into play pleasure w/out enjoyment

ROP.content: death drive and repetition compulsion (Wiederholungszwang), hyperbolic resistance of nonresistance, “resistance of the unconscious,” thwarts working through, une résistance qui n’a pas de sens (death drive), n’est pas une résistance > [does this concept present analysis itself? is it the structure of analysis? does it fold over? upset the meaning of the series?]
ROP.linkedContent: death drive and repetition compulsion (Wiederholungszwang), hyperbolic resistance of nonresistance, “resistance of the unconscious,” thwarts working through, une résistance qui n’a pas de sens (death drive), n’est pas une résistance > [does this concept present analysis itself? is it the structure of analysis? does it fold over? upset the meaning of the series?]

ROP.content: pourquoi mon explication avec l’analyse [psychoanalysis] a toujours eu ce goût de mort en poste restante qui m’a poussé à rôder sans fin dans les parages de Beyond the Pleasure Principle [?]
ROP.linkedContent: pourquoi mon explication avec l’analyse [psychoanalysis] a toujours eu ce goût de mort en poste restante qui m’a poussé à rôder sans fin dans les parages de Beyond the Pleasure Principle [?]

ROP.content: repetition compulsion (advocatus diaboli of death drive) as resource & limit (à la fois) of psychoanalysis > analytic position set going endlessly, w/out Aufhebung, in paradox of Bindung and Erlöschung (solution, extinction): no analytic position when resistance is unidentifiable
ROP.linkedContent: repetition compulsion (advocatus diaboli of death drive) as resource & limit (à la fois) of psychoanalysis > analytic position set going endlessly, w/out Aufhebung, in paradox of Bindung and Erlöschung (solution, extinction): no analytic position when resistance is unidentifiable

ROP.content: was not Freud looking for, in “death drive,” in “repetition compulsion,” the principle before the principle (of pleasure/reality), l’esprit de cette spirale, voilà qui tient en haleine [holds one in suspense], ou si vous aimez mieux: en vie
ROP.linkedContent: was not Freud looking for, in “death drive,” in “repetition compulsion,” the principle before the principle (of pleasure/reality), l’esprit de cette spirale, voilà qui tient en haleine [holds one in suspense], ou si vous aimez mieux: en vie

DIF.content: in Beyond Pleas…, difference btwn pleasure/reality principle is only differance as detour [if “only,” then not differance as relation to impossible presence?]
DIF.linkedContent: in Beyond Pleas…, difference btwn pleasure/reality principle is only differance as detour [if “only,” then not differance as relation to impossible presence?]

DPi.content: Rousseau “presumes” nobody premeditates himself getting hanged, oh really? really? > if no one dreamed of getting hanged: no murders or DP [p. 16 death drive and DP]
DPi.linkedContent: Rousseau “presumes” nobody premeditates himself getting hanged, oh really? really? > if no one dreamed of getting hanged: no murders or DP [p. 16 death drive and DP]

DPi.content: instant/instinct of death gathers together desire to kill & die [via/ Camus] > would suppression of DP frustrate these desires?
DPi.linkedContent: instant/instinct of death gathers together desire to kill & die [via/ Camus] > would suppression of DP frustrate these desires?

DPi.content: to run toward DP, to run toward suicide, to want to have done w/ the other > out of excess hatred/love
DPi.linkedContent: to run toward DP, to run toward suicide, to want to have done w/ the other > out of excess hatred/love

AFR.content: [re: need to desire, desire as end w/out end] moment stone (statue) comes to life, works to reduce gap, (not) become dead again—contrary to frivolous distraction, to headstrong identity of signs: fear of Medusa, legitimacy itself [fear of frivolous = fear of Medusa?]
AFR.linkedContent: [re: need to desire, desire as end w/out end] moment stone (statue) comes to life, works to reduce gap, (not) become dead again—contrary to frivolous distraction, to headstrong identity of signs: fear of Medusa, legitimacy itself [fear of frivolous = fear of Medusa?]

PSSS.content: death drive (Todestrieb), cruel drive of destruction, annihilation, but also cruelty in Bemächtigungstrieb (drive for power, sovereignty, mastery)
PSSS.linkedContent: death drive (Todestrieb), cruel drive of destruction, annihilation, but also cruelty in Bemächtigungstrieb (drive for power, sovereignty, mastery)

PSSS.content: Derrida evokes a beyond the death drive, beyond pleasure/reality principle, beyond drive for sovereign mastery, beyond cruelty—beyond the “mythology of drives” > the undecidable in psychoanalysis, the impossible other
PSSS.linkedContent: Derrida evokes a beyond the death drive, beyond pleasure/reality principle, beyond drive for sovereign mastery, beyond cruelty—beyond the “mythology of drives” > the undecidable in psychoanalysis, the impossible other

PSSS.content: arrivant, hospitality of visitation not invitation, beyond all instituting utterances, ce qui arrive, event, puts to rout performative act, sometimes cruelly, perhaps beyond the death drive, exceeds rules of hospitality: unpredictable for hosts
PSSS.linkedContent: arrivant, hospitality of visitation not invitation, beyond all instituting utterances, ce qui arrive, event, puts to rout performative act, sometimes cruelly, perhaps beyond the death drive, exceeds rules of hospitality: unpredictable for hosts

PSSS.content: death drive, origin of all cruelty—from sadism to primary masochism > this death drive sends reality/pleasure principles into crisis
PSSS.linkedContent: death drive, origin of all cruelty—from sadism to primary masochism > this death drive sends reality/pleasure principles into crisis

PSSS.content: for Freud, cruelty, aggression > death drive turned outward, toward “objects”
PSSS.linkedContent: for Freud, cruelty, aggression > death drive turned outward, toward “objects”

PSSS.content: Freud on indirect methods to combat war, ruse of detour (Umweg)
PSSS.linkedContent: Freud on indirect methods to combat war, ruse of detour (Umweg)

PSSS.content: Freud advocates submitting life of drives to Diktatur der Vernunft, a Utopia > indirect stratagem of Eros/Thanatos: contrary to the cruelty drive, though cruelty knows no end
PSSS.linkedContent: Freud advocates submitting life of drives to Diktatur der Vernunft, a Utopia > indirect stratagem of Eros/Thanatos: contrary to the cruelty drive, though cruelty knows no end

PSSS.content: [<small>AT IT AGAIN</small>] what I name, what I call for: w/out alibi, w/ or w/out bliss, beyond possible, beyond horizon, beyond the beyond, beyond economy, appropriable, possible—beyond death drive wherever Freud reintegrated it in economy of possible, economic conditionality
PSSS.linkedContent: [AT IT AGAIN] what I name, what I call for: w/out alibi, w/ or w/out bliss, beyond possible, beyond horizon, beyond the beyond, beyond economy, appropriable, possible—beyond death drive wherever Freud reintegrated it in economy of possible, economic conditionality

+R.content: fishing picture, record of a hunt: 2 death drives cross in an X (double diagonal): 1) pushes, attracts, holds down—descending column 2) the other, just as sublime, raises up, asphyxia of the phallus—ascending column
+R.linkedContent: fishing picture, record of a hunt: 2 death drives cross in an X (double diagonal): 1) pushes, attracts, holds down—descending column 2) the other, just as sublime, raises up, asphyxia of the phallus—ascending column

BSi.content: Freud speaks of an a-historical stasis of animals due to equilibrium btwn drives/environment [bees have a prehistory?]: mankind an irruption of destructive instinct [as history?]
BSi.linkedContent: Freud speaks of an a-historical stasis of animals due to equilibrium btwn drives/environment [bees have a prehistory?]: mankind an irruption of destructive instinct [as history?]

BSi.content: “who” and “what” sink into indifference, into the abyss of who-becoming-what (death)—becoming what we will have always been
BSi.linkedContent: “who” and “what” sink into indifference, into the abyss of who-becoming-what (death)—becoming what we will have always been

BSi.content: Bemächtigungstrieb: beyond other drives, beyond death drive, think sovereignty through drive, transference, inheritance, transmission, sovereignty itself is nothing, is excess, beyond everything
BSi.linkedContent: Bemächtigungstrieb: beyond other drives, beyond death drive, think sovereignty through drive, transference, inheritance, transmission, sovereignty itself is nothing, is excess, beyond everything

OG.content: Lévi-Strauss hypothesizes that primary function of writing is the enslavement of other humans, Derrida says yes, then describes how structure of society (castes, class, organs of capitalization, stocks), the origin of life in general, appears wherever it’s possible to defer (différer) presence, c’est-à-dire la dépense ou la consommation, et d’organiser la production, c’est-à-dire la réserve en général; he then adds [strangely] that the increase in differance [as proven by its extraordinary increase past few millenniums w/out change in organism] modifies life less & less as it spreads out (s’étend): should differance grow infinite, a possibility excluded by its essence, would be God or death
OG.linkedContent: Lévi-Strauss hypothesizes that primary function of writing is the enslavement of other humans, Derrida says yes, then describes how structure of society (castes, class, organs of capitalization, stocks), the origin of life in general, appears wherever it’s possible to defer (différer) presence, c’est-à-dire la dépense ou la consommation, et d’organiser la production, c’est-à-dire la réserve en général; he then adds [strangely] that the increase in differance [as proven by its extraordinary increase past few millenniums w/out change in organism] modifies life less & less as it spreads out (s’étend): should differance grow infinite, a possibility excluded by its essence, would be God or death

SPEC.content: death drive: être à l’oeuvre déjà (in PP), ça se sera écrit en silence—in speculative overflow
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive: être à l’oeuvre déjà (in PP), ça se sera écrit en silence—in speculative overflow

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s “speculative” writing] démarche of this writing, advancing w/out advancing, time of a detour, pas de thèse repeats itself: PP will not let anything be done w/out it, except repetition itself
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s “speculative” writing] démarche of this writing, advancing w/out advancing, time of a detour, pas de thèse repeats itself: PP will not let anything be done w/out it, except repetition itself

SPEC.content: Wiederholungszwang (repetition compulsion) put in communication w/ death drive
SPEC.linkedContent: Wiederholungszwang (repetition compulsion) put in communication w/ death drive

SPEC.content: repetition, reproductivity, works w/out saying anything, like death drive, not even “form,” w/out thesis, de-monstration makes its proof (preuve) sans montrer > de-monstration folds into everything it makes explicit, pas de démonstration remains (reste) in this restance
SPEC.linkedContent: repetition, reproductivity, works w/out saying anything, like death drive, not even “form,” w/out thesis, de-monstration makes its proof (preuve) sans montrer > de-monstration folds into everything it makes explicit, pas de démonstration remains (reste) in this restance

SPEC.content: death drive, w/out contradicting PP, hollows it out, older, not an other mastery (Herrschaft), but other than master, tout autre (not dialectically opposed to PP as life, living, alive)
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive, w/out contradicting PP, hollows it out, older, not an other mastery (Herrschaft), but other than master, tout autre (not dialectically opposed to PP as life, living, alive)

SPEC.content: déclencheur (trigger-effect) of the déchaînement, unbinding, destricturation > repetition compulsion & death drive unbind from all contracture
SPEC.linkedContent: déclencheur (trigger-effect) of the déchaînement, unbinding, destricturation > repetition compulsion & death drive unbind from all contracture

SPEC.content: thus far in Beyond… differential stricture of repetition has not demanded a word about death
SPEC.linkedContent: thus far in Beyond… differential stricture of repetition has not demanded a word about death

SPEC.content: death drive: Freud’s “inertia inherent in organic life”
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive: Freud’s “inertia inherent in organic life”

SPEC.content: living is differential of force organized by force of inscription [how did Derrida get here?]
SPEC.linkedContent: living is differential of force organized by force of inscription [how did Derrida get here?]

SPEC.content: detour expanding immeasurably: Umweg of 1st Chapter secondary to absolute/unconditional Umweg > pas de détour always leads back to death, not a question of going (aller) but of coming back (revenir)—this is the passage
SPEC.linkedContent: detour expanding immeasurably: Umweg of 1st Chapter secondary to absolute/unconditional Umweg > pas de détour always leads back to death, not a question of going (aller) but of coming back (revenir)—this is the passage

SPEC.content: Weg (is) Umweg, weg as adverb signifies “far away,” fort!, go away!
SPEC.linkedContent: Weg (is) Umweg, weg as adverb signifies “far away,” fort!, go away!

SPEC.content: race to death, exhausts couriers, witnesses, relays, from post to post
SPEC.linkedContent: race to death, exhausts couriers, witnesses, relays, from post to post

SPEC.content: pas de plus > deux temps of drive: 1) conserves 2) insures path to death, pas de mort, organism arrives by its own (internal) step at death (eigenen Todesweg): s’envoyer the message of one’s own death
SPEC.linkedContent: pas de plus > deux temps of drive: 1) conserves 2) insures path to death, pas de mort, organism arrives by its own (internal) step at death (eigenen Todesweg): s’envoyer the message of one’s own death

SPEC.content: partial drive: assists in death, return closest to oneself as if to one’s origin, s’envoyer > in the pas de détour, organism guards against the other stealing death from it: to be the facteur of its death
SPEC.linkedContent: partial drive: assists in death, return closest to oneself as if to one’s origin, s’envoyer > in the pas de détour, organism guards against the other stealing death from it: to be the facteur of its death

SPEC.content: [Freud’s death drive] autoteleguiding, suicide deferred, wishes to sound its own glas, wishes the impossible > most driven drive is drive of the proper, drive to reappropriate oneself, stronger than life & death
SPEC.linkedContent: [Freud’s death drive] autoteleguiding, suicide deferred, wishes to sound its own glas, wishes the impossible > most driven drive is drive of the proper, drive to reappropriate oneself, stronger than life & death

SPEC.content: but S is never P, since heterology is involved, there’s force & thus legacy, sending, envoi: the proper is not the proper
SPEC.linkedContent: but S is never P, since heterology is involved, there’s force & thus legacy, sending, envoi: the proper is not the proper

SPEC.content: in both Freud & Heidegger, life death no longer opposed in the proper [both interpret death as proper? unlike Levinas & Derrida]
SPEC.linkedContent: in both Freud & Heidegger, life death no longer opposed in the proper [both interpret death as proper? unlike Levinas & Derrida]

SPEC.content: why would Dasein, “our own,” have to constitute itself as démarcheur [stockbroker, bad step]?
SPEC.linkedContent: why would Dasein, “our own,” have to constitute itself as démarcheur [stockbroker, bad step]?

SPEC.content: let me die properly: where death is my inheritance
SPEC.linkedContent: let me die properly: where death is my inheritance

SPEC.content: analytic of Da-sein (analytic of distance, proximity)—not so foreign to analysis of fort/da > economy of death, law of proper, auto-affection of fort:da, “eigenen Todesweg des Organismus”
SPEC.linkedContent: analytic of Da-sein (analytic of distance, proximity)—not so foreign to analysis of fort/da > economy of death, law of proper, auto-affection of fort:da, “eigenen Todesweg des Organismus”

SPEC.content: Freud’s auto-affective structure of time, life as the auto-affection of death, differance lodged in desire (desire nothing but this) for this auto-tely: auto-delegates & arrives only by differing in tout autre [for Freud, life-death announced to serve the proper, an economy of death]
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s auto-affective structure of time, life as the auto-affection of death, differance lodged in desire (desire nothing but this) for this auto-tely: auto-delegates & arrives only by differing in tout autre [for Freud, life-death announced to serve the proper, an economy of death]

SPEC.content: turning sadistic drive into death drive, sadism reappropriated into our service, turned toward us (implied: against Jung) > masochism as primary—operates otherwise than supplementary/derivative turn [from sadism?]
SPEC.linkedContent: turning sadistic drive into death drive, sadism reappropriated into our service, turned toward us (implied: against Jung) > masochism as primary—operates otherwise than supplementary/derivative turn [from sadism?]

SPEC.content: Nirvana—death drive, teleology organizes return of old, oldest, furthest away
SPEC.linkedContent: Nirvana—death drive, teleology organizes return of old, oldest, furthest away

SPEC.content: power (posts) as transcendental predicate (not to be confused w/ death drive or repetition compulsion, gives us w/ what to describe them) > still, though borrowing descriptive traits from Bemächtigung, death drive & repetition compulsion overflow power > there is only differance of power, whence the posts, “will to power” [?]
SPEC.linkedContent: power (posts) as transcendental predicate (not to be confused w/ death drive or repetition compulsion, gives us w/ what to describe them) > still, though borrowing descriptive traits from Bemächtigung, death drive & repetition compulsion overflow power > there is only differance of power, whence the posts, “will to power” [?]

SPEC.content: death drive doesn’t work in silence (like in French translation), but goes unnoticed (unauffällig), has to do w/ time (link to Kant, Aristotle)—thus rhythm: do feelings of tension exist to distinguish btwn bound/unbound energy or do they exist in relation to absolute magnitude?
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive doesn’t work in silence (like in French translation), but goes unnoticed (unauffällig), has to do w/ time (link to Kant, Aristotle)—thus rhythm: do feelings of tension exist to distinguish btwn bound/unbound energy or do they exist in relation to absolute magnitude?
